answers.answer: A friend of mine had to do the same thing because she had really bad placenta previa.  I know for a fact that she had her amino the day before her c/s and she got her results back fairly quickly but I am not sure exactly when. Since you are doing yours the day of I would imagine that they can get the results very quickly the.  This would be a good question to ask your doctor and I would even ask if they plan on making you wait in the hospital.Wow, August 8th you are due after me and I can't have my c/s until August 11th!!!!!

Actually I was really suppose to have c/s at 39 weeks which would have been 8/27 or so.   But because of all my issues the OB says I'm a risk for having still born and he wants baby out as soon as possible.  So they are wanting to get baby out 3 weeks earlier.I was going to ask OB, but I don't see him until next week.

They told me that I'd have the results the next day. Probably because it's being done at the perinatologist's office, not the hospital. If you're scheduled for the amnio in the hospital, I'm sure they'll get the results within a few hours. So, my amnio is July 8, get the results July 9 and - if all is well - induce on July 10.

Well post how the amnio went!  And the results if you can.  I'm not thrilled of the idea of getting a needle jabbed in my abdomen and spine all in the same day.   Hopefully it won't be that bad.  It's my understanding that it's a pretty thin needle.
8/8 that's so soon! So is that the date you would have the baby or would they go back 3 weeks from there into July?

how many weeks are you? If you are 34 weeks and under, it's not too late for steroid shots just in case. My dr is giving me steroids at 34 weeks just in case, since I had preeclampsia last time.Also, I would speak to the doctor about doing the c-sec the next morning. My c-section was at 5 PM and it was torture going ALL day without eating or drinking anything. I didn't know I was having the section that day until my dr called me at 8 AM, so I hadn't eaten since the night before.  I know it doesn't sound like a big deal, but it was awful and I was miserable. My lips and gums were bleeding, my mouth was dry, the heartburn from not having any food in my stomach and not being able to take my pepsid. And going without food when you're pregnant... well I was not a happy camper.

To NicMom.....my real due date is 9/3, but I was going to have a planned C-section on 8/27 and the 8/8 date is the bumped up date.   I will be 36w2d at that point.tiredbuthappy:   I am currently 30w6d.   I was wondering about the steroid shots.  I would have thought I'd get those too.   I was planning to ask my OB at my next visit this coming Tuesday.   And I have thought about having to not drink and eat all day between the amnio and c-section and wondered if they'd release me or keep in the hospital.  I've done a little research and it seems that some results are coming back within 3 to 4 hours.  I could deal with that.   I'm not sure if my doc would go for that...he's already doing this on a saturday.   But I was concerned about all the discomforts you were mentioning!   Maybe they'll give me ice chips!

So do they have to do an amnio in order to induce??? All mine have been  natural and when ever they are ready, but I was thinking about talking to my dr about this one bc I would like him on the 1st of Aug. instead of around the 20th.

They will do an amnio to check for fetal lung maturity.  Apparently there is a protein or something that is in the amniotic fluid that they measure to see if the baby's lungs are mature or not.   It doesn't necessarily induce labor, however, I have heard that it can.   I'm having a c-section, however.And you don't really want to have your baby earlier than it's suppose to come.  The only reason they are doing this on me is because I'm having a lot of problems.  At my last visit the doctor said I'm at risk (not sure how much) for having a stillborn and they wanted to get the baby out as soon as they could.My baby is small for gestational age (which means it's smaller than most babies at the same # of weeks), I've got a two-vessel umbilical cord, i have to take blood thinners, and I've got gestational diabetes.I'm seriously comfortable with the baby coming two weeks early and better yet one week early, but four weeks early does scare me.  Baby possibly may have to be in NICU for a week, but I'm praying everything goes well.

My son was born about 3 to 4 weeks early and he didn't have any problems. Just went under the O2 tent for a few hours, but other than that he was healthy. As long as the lungs are ready you should be fine. Don't stress too much. I just can't belive how quick that is. I know if they knocked a month off my due date I would be running around like crazy trying to get everything ready.

they wouldn't even let me have ice chips :(definitely talk to your doctor about the steroid. Sounds like in your case, benefits of early delivery definitely outweigh the risks. I'm with you- I'd much rather carry the baby til the end than have her come early. My first was delivered via c-section at 36 weeks, and while her lungs were mature, she was tiny and had feeding issues that made the following months a very stressful nightmare for us.i thought my dr was being overcautious by giving me the steroid shot at 34 weeks, but he said that lung development is a very important factor that he can help by administering prophylactic steroids. that way if i develop complications again, it will be one thing he won't have to worry about.

To tired but happy:  I am definitely going to inquire about steroid shots!To NicMom:   Oh we are running around like crazy.  I've got all the baby stuff, but it's still in bags.  I've been reluctant to get everything put together because I'm so worried about this not happening for us.  I've had 5 miscarriages and tons of issues with this pregnancy, I just won't believe it until I see it!!    I kind of feel if I put a nursery together that I'm just tempting the universe!   Superstituous, I know, but I'm pretty sure I'm not the first to ever feel this way.   In old Jewish tradition you're not suppose to have any baby things in the house until after the baby is born.    I can certainly relate to that tradition.
Oh sweetie at this point I think it's okay to unpack those bags! At least the newborn supplies ;-)

question: Does anyone have an idea?  My due date was bumped up to 8/8.  OB wants to do an amnio to check if my lungs are mature at 36 weeks and if they are they will do a c-section.   He said they'd do amnio in the morning and the c/s that night.   So that makes me wonder how long does it take to get the results in?  And I hope I won't have to hang out in the hospital until the results come in....that will be pretty boring.
title: How long does it take to get results of amnio for lung maturity?
